text: Impaired asset is an accounting term referring to an asset that has a market value lower than the value recorded on its owner’s balance sheet. Impairment is an essential accounting practice to ensure that assets are not overvalued on the financial statements, providing a realistic view of a company’s asset value. == References == == Other websites == * Official site of the Financial Accounting Standards Board * Official site of the International Financial Reporting Standards Category:Accounting
